website_summaries.verdict: Budget strap cutter you can keep on a keychain or in a pocket for emergencies.
pros: Small multitool features a basic strap cutter meant for seat belts and other thin fabrics
Also comes with a bottle opener, screwdriver, and wrench with keychain ring
cons: Included protective cover does not fit the tool well, allowing the tool to possibly fall out

customer_reviews.title: Good start but...
customer_reviews.text: The rubber cover has stayed on for the short time I have had this on my keyring. The oxygen key works fine as long as the valve on the tank hasn't been tightened by Chuck Norris. Edit 1/18/19: So far I haven't lost the protective cover which is still snug on the tool, though I've only taken it off a few times. Edit 1/25/18: The cover is not staying in place now and the point of the tool has frayed the top of my jeans pocket. Took it off my key ring. Will have to adjust rating accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: gnak

customer_reviews.title: Pretty useful design, value priced
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: This is a good tool but the 8CR13MoV seems like it could be harder for everyday use. However that is offset by the price. Pros: The compact design Inexpensive compared to competitors Useful for opening boxes 5 tools in one, strap cutter, bottle opener, two wrenches and standard screwdriver Cons: The standard screwdriver is very thin, making it not as useful as a screwdriver. In order to give the tip a wider profile I ground it down Cover is not very secure and easily lost The steel is not wear resistant, so you'll need to maintain cutting edge with a small round sharpener
customer_reviews.author: Ed Raton

customer_reviews.title: Small but heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: A nice compact design. Be careful, it looks like you are buying 2 of these but it's just one. The image shows it with the protective cover on and off. My only complaint so far is that the protective rubber cover will not stay on the tool. Otherwise the ring and the tool both seem to be durable. I like the mix of tools including the O2 bottle wrench. I don't know how many times I've dropped the O2 wrench and had to scramble trying to find it in the grass, rocks and etc. while we were working. Great backup to have in case the wrench decides to vanish or break.
customer_reviews.author: James Burke

customer_reviews.title: handy product
customer_reviews.text: I am an advanced EMT in the Alaskan bush and this is one of the most useful thing I have ever had on my key ring I never need to reach further than my pocket when I can't lay hands on a scissors or O2 wrench, I have cut everything from clothes to kerlix gauze and packing tape with the blade and despite its small size there is plenty of leverage to open tightly closed oxygen tank valves too.
customer_reviews.author: J~

customer_reviews.title: Poor design overall. Hooks on pants constantly.
customer_reviews.text: After looking at dozens of key chain tools, i bought this one specifically for the belt cutter. Put it on belt tab hanging key ring w keys and it is constantly hooking my pants. Had to remove it. Bottle opener function is terrible. Would be best left in your car in an accessible location for emergency extraction. Otherwise I wouldnt recommend this one. I will be buying the longer rectangular style keychain tool with the belt cutter positioned at the end of the long side (can be found on Amazon).
customer_reviews.author: Josh Spice

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable Multi Tool
customer_reviews.text: My only issue is due to the nature of the design. The hook-style blade will get caught in my pocket when I'm trying to take my keys out of my pocket. Keeping the plastic guard on the tip will help with this, but I lost the guard during the first week I owned it. I've got no idea where that thing went. Works great as a pry blade, screwdriver, and box opener.
customer_reviews.author: Dan-O

customer_reviews.title: Columbia River Knife and Tool 2055 K.E.R.T Key Ring Emergency Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a key ring tool for work. Upon its arrival it went onto my personal key ring! The design and build is excellent and the screwdriver/pry tip works great. I've cut several seatbelts during our extrication drills this year and it zips through them like a hot knife through butter. The only thing that kept it from getting five stars is the key ring itself - it would be much better served with a braided cable type ring to give better strength when pulling.
customer_reviews.author: John Z.

customer_reviews.title: Ouchy
customer_reviews.text: Enjoy the heck out of this thing but can't tate 5 stars when the pointed end stabs your hand when trying to change out and o2 tank. More of a design flaw than anything else considering that it's the seat belt cutter end. Really like it though. Cool, handy and it is convenient to have on my keys. Just wish it felt better in the hand
customer_reviews.author: that dude

customer_reviews.title: sturdy construction and minimalist design.
customer_reviews.text: great minimal keychain multi-tool. It comes with a small black silicone cover that goes on the top 1/3rd of the tool and stays on well in my pocket. I haven't had to use the seat belt cutter on an actual seat belt (thankfully) but it works great on rubber bands or other tags. I like having this tool on my keychain just in case of emergency. very sturdy construction and material. would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: kbl

customer_reviews.title: mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Even with the included guard on, the screwdriver end sticks out. This will soon wear a hole in your pocket. The cutter doesn't work as well as the cutters on similar devices. There are holes for a nut wrench or oxygen tank, but the tool is too short to get much leverage on these.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Four stars but worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good quality product. I just wish it was a little longer. Some of those oxygen tanks are hard to open with such a short wrench. You can not get much strength behind it because it is metal and does leave some indention's in your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Dirt_Poor_PickerTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: First, I am a big fan of CRKT. So it was no surprise that this is a great little tool. I work in an emergency room in one of the biggest hospitals in WV, and just in one day this has paid for itself. I literally had a use for it in the first 5 minutes of my work day. For about the cost of a pack of cigarettes, you wouldn't be sorry after grabbing one. Probably will have a stock issue since everyone I work with wants one
customer_reviews.author: Calvary McGuire

customer_reviews.title: K.E.R.T. works as described but...
customer_reviews.text: K.E.R.T. works as described but I can't say I love the product. While it was very sharp out of the package I was sad the markings for the wrench size, etc. were not on the product as they were in the picture. I was also sad to see the rubber blade-cap is easy to lose or accidentally cut; mine actually arrived with it cut open ( down the side that rests against the dull-side of the blade ). The removal of the markings isn't a big deal and a ranger-band could ( at least I think it could ) work as a replacement to the cap but I couldn't recommend the product because of these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but hard to get leverage to turn for screwing
customer_reviews.text: This is as described and the metal is hard the reason for the 3 stars is it is too short to get proper leverage to screw/unscrew or open/close oxygen valves w/o lots of trouble. Also the shortness makes it impossible to use with many of the O2 tanks we use because the regulator get in the way. The seatbelt cutter is sharp. Good idea, medium execution.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Nice EDC or Hospital/EMS use
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice EDC item I keep it with me while in the car and at work in the emergency department there isn't much to say since it is a pretty straightforward product the oxygen wrench is a nice benfit if you work in a hospital or EMS. And the seat belt cutter is very sharp and cuts with ease. The flathead is a little small for some uses but has mostly worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: ER Tech 92

customer_reviews.title: Everything except the bottle opener
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for a paramedic. The O2 key and belt cutter work great. Bottle opener kinda sucks but still does the job. Too cheap and handy of an item to pass up on. Update 01/05/2016: I use this thing all the time at work, at home, in the car, etc. I couldn't live without it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Good for boxes and oxygen tanks :-)
customer_reviews.text: I am a Registered Nurse and this if perfect for that as the item has a wrench for oxygen tanks, I mostly use it for opening supply boxes.
customer_reviews.author: ba

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to keep around
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing. It is a must on my work keychain now. The box cutter works well and the oxygen key works perfect for it to be so compact.
customer_reviews.author: Chad McCool

customer_reviews.title: Meh..
customer_reviews.text: Was excited about using this at work to changeouts some oxygen tanks. But it was not easy to use. It was very hard to unscrew the regulator on the tanks, but opening cylinder valve was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Thuubular

customer_reviews.title: Small but efficient. Easy to carry in my pocket.
customer_reviews.text: It is very solid, which is exactly what I was looking for. Typically, as an EMT I use the hard plastic oxygen regulator keys. But they bend and break. My only complaint is how small it is.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J Mustain

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I am a nurse and use this daily at work . I love always having an oxygen tank key handy plus I’m able to open boxes quick . This is a time saver . Good quality . I bought s second for a coworker and she loves hers
customer_reviews.author: Dori

customer_reviews.title: Handy keyring tool
customer_reviews.text: Very good handy tool. TSA compliant they say but b@stards took it anyway. Idiots. Bought another cause it’s handy.
customer_reviews.author: Happy man

customer_reviews.title: Short work of potato chip bags, works on blister packs.
customer_reviews.text: Not willing to test this on my car seat belts, all I can assure you is that this is dazzlingly sharp on envelopes and makes short work of opening potato chip bags. The actual cutting portion of the edge is tiny and scalloped in on BOTH sides, unlike some that leave the sharp edge closer to your finger or thumb. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MWebb

customer_reviews.title: Great little multi tool!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is AWESOME! It goes everywhere with me now, just like my edc knife. Within the first week of owning it I found myself using it more than I thought I would. The flathead tip, the cutter, and even the O2 key!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Low profile, Well Made
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I was tired of my edc including a blade, multi-tool, a flashlight, and so on and so forth. Now I have this bad boy and a streamlight nano on my keychain and I'm good to go! The strap cutter on this guy is sharp, the overall profile is low key. I haven't really run across an O2 tank but I'm sure one day I will. This thing is solid. There are more intensive tasks this thing can't handle but for everyday stuff this gets the job done without me having to bring my entire kit about.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Tran

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I work in psychiatry So this is a fantastic tool to cut someone down when seconds can make the difference from how much brain and cardiac tissue dies and lives
customer_reviews.author: the bombartmenter

customer_reviews.title: The protective rubber sheath falls off easily, Bought three and gave as gifts to fellow ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Shipped quickly and arrived on time. The protective rubber sheath falls off easily, Bought three and gave as gifts to fellow workers and all three had the sheath fall off and get lost within a day. Other than that a good product
customer_reviews.author: Mark Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely high quality! Built very well! Perfect keychain tool to carry!
customer_reviews.author: Cordell

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool.
customer_reviews.text: The most useful Keychain. I use it for cutting seamlesses in a photo studio. Also works for opening packages and all kinds of other things. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny L.

customer_reviews.title: Call little tool
customer_reviews.text: Cool little tool don't really like the rubber cover for the end
customer_reviews.author: WA HANSEN

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift and he loved it. It's sturdy and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Krystle J.

customer_reviews.title: Needs a decent sheath.
customer_reviews.text: Product is solid but the sheath got lost and eventually cut my pocket open. O2 wrench cutout is a little tight so if the valve is damaged it won't fit sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Ruffalo

customer_reviews.title: Works so far.
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t tested on a seatbelt yet but works wonderfully on packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Sipl

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool with room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: It's a useful little tool but I'd love to see some improvements. The first would be the inclusion of a smaller flatblade screwdriver which could double as a philips in a pinch. Maybe this could be on the protruding end of the cutter tool. The other would be a revision to the black plastic cover over the seatbelt cutter. It will NOT stay on and although I've managed to find it each time, I expect to lose it in a matter of days.
customer_reviews.author: ExMoto

customer_reviews.title: Needs a more secure protective sleeve.
customer_reviews.text: Lost 1 star because the rubber protective sleeve came off and got lost. Otherwise a perfect tool.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Belt cutter, Oxegen tank shut off.
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than expected. Due to its size, it will fit on a key ring.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest F. Przybyla

customer_reviews.title: very handy cutting tool from CRKT
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I didn't like was the keyring stretched out when I pulled on it cutting something. The sharp edge is in the center, since it is sharpened on both sides, making it almost impossible for you to feel the edge with your finger. It is very sharp and a handy pocket knife to have.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart H. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. Low price. Quality company.
customer_reviews.text: I base this review assuming it will cut a seatbelt cord. It is the perfect size for a keychain, and the keychain is the perfect place to have one of these devices if you need it. It is made by a quality company for a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little multipurpose tool
customer_reviews.text: Great little multi purpose tool. I primarily use the recessed blade to open boxes and the slot opening to open oxygen tank valves.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mast

customer_reviews.title: Works great for that and I felt better about buying the ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used all of the features yet. Bought it because I'm around someone who is on oxygen therapy and I wanted to never be without an o2 bottle wrench. Works great for that and I felt better about buying the CRKT steel as opposed to some unknown Chinese knock off.
customer_reviews.author: lefty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great little keychain tool the cutting part is great for cutting zip ties that are normally had to cut with scissors
customer_reviews.author: Maxiebre

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Fits on the O2 tank better than the cheap little plastic one I purchased. Just wished it had a better grip or was longer so I could twist it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn-Ivy

customer_reviews.title: I have a family member on oxygen,
customer_reviews.text: I have a family member on oxygen, this is a lifesaver I bought 4 and shared with family now everyone has one for an emergency
customer_reviews.author: krista Kulow

customer_reviews.title: Compact and actually useful
customer_reviews.text: This keychain is awesome and compact. The seatbelt cutter is insanely sharp out of the box. It will cut through paper, cardboard, and seatbelts (obviously) as if they weren’t even there. This keychain has already proven to be very useful and I can’t wait for other opportunities to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely well made but I think it's a little over priced when compared to the Gerber shard. Still a great product and worthwhile to have on your keychain.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Cool Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool little tool for your keyring. I haven't had a chance to use it for anything yet, but it is something that you can get through TSA with. It has a slot for an oxygen tank. I can't remember ever needing an oxygen tank wrench, but if I ever do, I have one now.
customer_reviews.author: G. Norman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item
customer_reviews.text: Rubber cap for cutter kept falling off and eventually got lost. Other than that, it's excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little addition to my keychain
customer_reviews.text: Nice little addition to my keychain. Nice knowing i have an emergency seat belt cutter at all times. Hopefull never need it for that reason, but if i did i know it will do the job, very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Kayakfisher

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have other knives like this but this is nicer because it fits on my keychain
customer_reviews.author: Matthew germain

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry .Always in my pocket,great to have if needed. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: Luis E Rosado

customer_reviews.title: Love this little guy
customer_reviews.text: This tool works great for my needs. I don't use the O2 wrench and I haven't used the bit driver yet but build quality seems excellent and the seat belt cutter (I use it to open packages) and bottle opener work great.
customer_reviews.author: skiatd1

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work and it functions really well. The cutter is also good for parachute cord. Be careful with were you keep it though, the cutter/bottle opener can occasionally get hung up on a chair if you wear it on a key ring on your belt.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought. I won't return it, but had they put a ruler beside the picture, I would have known it size and looked for something bigger. I guess that's why the DON'T put a ruler beside it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control Issues ?
customer_reviews.text: I'm really disappointed with this tool, having purchased it for the hook blade. The one I received is as sharp as a marble. 15 minutes with a diamond file has made some difference, but it is still nowhere near fit for the marketed purpose of cutting a seat belt in an emergency. It struggles to cut a single core of paracord, or a 20mm lanyard tape. Other reviewers have commented that theirs is razor sharp, so I guess I got a bad one. Also, as others have noted, the rubber sheath/shield comes off at the first opportunity.
customer_reviews.author: TimLH

customer_reviews.title: Love it but the sheath....
customer_reviews.text: .... The sheath slips off so many times I've had it fall 4 times in less than a week I've had it. Other than that. It's great.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Wish it came in different colors
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what you expect. Good product. Wish it came in different colors.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone Danger Skillet

customer_reviews.title: CRKT K.E.R.T.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little rescue tool. Slightly larger than I expected but not complaining. The soft plastic cover fits good and doesn't slide off. Large key ring included. Good quality metal and finish.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. I hang on my oxygen bottle and use to remove plastic cover and to turn oxygen on
customer_reviews.author: Linda O'Hare

customer_reviews.title: Different item received
customer_reviews.text: It's not what I ordered, but I will keep it. It will work for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Solange

customer_reviews.title: Just got this in yesterday. Plan on carrying on ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in yesterday. Plan on carrying on my keys with a quick release. The silicone cover is difficult to remove by hand and I can see it warping in the summer, but it does slide up and reveals the blade when in use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Salpas

customer_reviews.title: best keychain ever!
customer_reviews.text: perfect for opening amazon boxes! It works decently well as a bottle opener too.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Works great as an oxygen key
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Works great as an oxygen key, seatbelt cutter comes in super useful, little screwdriver on the end is perfect! Lost my little cover within the first week tho, wish there was a way to buy more of those.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I’m an EMT and I absolutely love this! Good quality and exactly as pictured.
customer_reviews.author: Tifancy WW

customer_reviews.title: Large keyring is nice. Great steel
customer_reviews.text: Large keyring is nice. Great steel, even shaved a little off the keyring putting it on. I work in a critical care unit, and with this on my keychain I never have to worry about finding an oxygen wrench in an emergency. Also gives peace of mind for cutting seatbelts if I'm in a crash, or stop at one.
customer_reviews.author: OKCJaeda

customer_reviews.title: Must have for all drivers, compact, not bulky
customer_reviews.text: This is a must-have item for anyone who drives a vehicle. This tool is perfectly compact enough to not make your key chain too bulky. I love that not only can it be used in emergency situations to cut through seat belts, but it is also a bit of a multi-tool. I will be buying another one for my husband's key chain as this is a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G

customer_reviews.title: wanted to like this
customer_reviews.text: to small to use as an o2 key safety cap will get lost on day 1
customer_reviews.author: S. Grande

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for EMT
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Sheath is rather annoying as it constantly slips off and risks cutting my pants.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well the first couple cuts but got dull pretty fast. Also the black cover you see comes off way too easy. Its a pain to open O2 tanks with as it's all mental with not enough to hold on to so you hurt your hand and struggle
customer_reviews.author: luis ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these for every keychain in the house. Good just in case. The screwdriver end can also be used as a window breaker, though not the best tool for the job. And don't ask how I know.
customer_reviews.author: Big in Portland

customer_reviews.title: handy tool
customer_reviews.text: handy tool i keep on my keychain to open o2 bottles on ambulance. i cant speak for the other functions but it looks sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Thenaturalmedic

customer_reviews.title: impulse buy but not a bad item
customer_reviews.text: impulse buy mostly, nice to have if needed it would be great to have. not a bad key chain except the black protective cover is quickly and easily lost then the cutting area snags on EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.author: UManiac

customer_reviews.title: I've used it a couple of times for simple cutting jobs and it did great!
customer_reviews.text: I wear this in the knife sleeve of my flight suit. It's so small and lightweight I forget it's there. I've used it a couple of times for simple cutting jobs and it did great!
customer_reviews.author: AaronF

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Would be 5 stars if the black gard would have stayed on and not have gotten lost. Fits well in my hand when using on oxygen tanks. It's as light and more useful than a nylon O2 wrinch One note with out black cover it will snangs easy
customer_reviews.author: james w. reed jr

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and safe
customer_reviews.text: I work in a secure facility where you cannot carry knives or tools, but I am able to secure this to my key lanyard. I have used it to tighten screws, odd cutting jobs, and cleaning my nails. The plastic cover lasted about two days and the hook does sometimes snag, but I have yet to have it cut anything I did not want it to. It is a well designed tool, that is safe and easily secured
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Burns

customer_reviews.title: Terrible material.
customer_reviews.text: I took it to kitesurf the day I received it. The next day it started to rust badly. Terrible material.
customer_reviews.author: frederic barone

customer_reviews.title: Cover falls off easily
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had to use it but the black cover kept falling off and it the blade would catch things including my daughter's hair.
customer_reviews.author: DeNice

customer_reviews.title: Great little add-on gadget.
customer_reviews.text: Great little add-on gadget. TSA has had no problem yet! Comes in handy to cut off security zip ties that some of the beefy international airports place on your bags
customer_reviews.author: Alan In ATL

customer_reviews.title: The black cover falls off all the time and the ...
customer_reviews.text: The black cover falls off all the time and the set up of the seat belt cutter doesn't make much sense the way it is set up. It catches on things
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: I have started to put the tool through its paces ...
customer_reviews.text: I have started to put the tool through its paces. The one problem I have experienced so far is the rubber cover. I was taking my keys out of my pocket and the cutter got stock on the edge and the it split the rubber in half. The cover should probably be kydex or something similar.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J Agostino

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool little tool, I bought it for my wife to put on her key ring to use as a seatbelt cutter in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: A little smaller than I expected, but completely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Rusted over in the matter of a week in humid terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: This product is great and lightweight I keep it on my keys it’s ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is great and lightweight I keep it on my keys it’s a little bit large but nothing that isn’t manageable and the strap cutter really does work amazing
customer_reviews.author: Edward Dormitzer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome I never lose my oxygen tank wrench again.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Oliverio

customer_reviews.title: and it made a good first impression
customer_reviews.text: Got this today, and it made a good first impression. Nice and small. The bottle opener works well (first thing I tried). I'm going to carry it without the rubber boot thing for a while and see how that works out, if I don't update this then it can be assumed to work out well. The picture is on my key chain, for relative size purposes. A bit larger than my house keys but shorter than my truck key. That's a Fenix E05 flashlight, and a SOG key knife next to it.
customer_reviews.author: Rooger

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to open electrical enclosures, cut tape and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to open electrical enclosures, cut tape and open boxes at work without having to carry a screw driver and cut resistant gloves all the time. Works.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Messier

customer_reviews.title: CRKT Emergency tool
customer_reviews.text: Very good for a EMT but not as friendly for air travel the Gerber hook knife is better for TSA
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Handy Tool For Auto
customer_reviews.text: This is a great safety tool and handy. The cover us useless and will not stay on the tool Great service and received on time.
customer_reviews.author: CES Rocks

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: everything as I expected. Columbia River Knife and Tool 2055 K.E.R.T Key Ring Emergency Tool Strap Cutter Lightweight Key ring included Rubber cap over cutting hook Razor sharp seatbelt cutter .8oz; 2.48-Inch
customer_reviews.author: Algree

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. If you are in EMS higly reccomend buying for quick change of portable O2 tanks.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Albritton

customer_reviews.title: Super useful keychain
customer_reviews.text: Best tool for anyone who use's o2. The cover stays on well. I use it constantly. No bottle opener though.
customer_reviews.author: .45hunter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very useful tool to have around. Very compact in size and easy to cary.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Wittman, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: carry on key chain in the event I forget my normal oxygen key.
customer_reviews.author: jim r.

customer_reviews.title: Great Rescue and multi tool. Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, solid keychain tool. Several critical uses. Great size. One of the few tools out there that have an O2 Wrench! Great for EMT, Firefighters, Rescue etc...
customer_reviews.author: JD Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: It's small. It does what it is supposed to. I use it at work where I need to cut stuff but it's too dangerous to use a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Bonpierce

customer_reviews.title: Handy Tool
customer_reviews.text: I use it every day at work,but lost the blade cover the first week but tool is still functional
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for opening oxygen
customer_reviews.text: Seat belt cutter works. Great for opening oxygen. Plastic cover was gone first time used it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have this attached to my retractable keychain and it works great for cutting boxes open and using the top part as a screw driver. The only thing I didn't like about it was the cover can be easily lost.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Leon

customer_reviews.title: Good design and the right size without having to carry ...
customer_reviews.text: Good design and the right size without having to carry a knife, it works perfectly with keys. Plastic sheath doesn't stay on that we'll however.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Rounds

customer_reviews.title: Nice, But Don't Expect to Open a Bottle With It
customer_reviews.text: Nifty gadget. Nice to have something slim and light on my keychain. I tried to open a bottle cap with it, though, and there was no way it was going to work. Complete failure in this respect. I call "foul" on the bottle opener feature.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

product_meta.title: CRKT K.E.R.T. EDC Keyring Micro Tool: Lightweight Multi-Tool for Everyday Carry, Seatbelt Cutter, Bottle Opener, Screwdriver, Two Wrenches 2055
product_meta.description:
Designer Ray Kirk has put his spin on the concept of an emergency strap cutter with his new K.E.R.T. (Keyring Emergency Rescue Tool).

Now you can have a razor sharp seatbelt cutter always at the ready hanging on your key ring. This nifty little tool also excels in cutting webbing, or fibrous materials, when needed. It features a screwdriver, oxygen tank opener, bottle opener, and 1/4" hex wrench.

This is a pocket sized tool that is designed to make your life easier, maybe prevent a headache or two, and perform necessary emergency tasks. The K.E.R.T. comes with a form fitted vinyl slip-sheath.

Don't be caught unprepared, stay safe, and put one on your keychain today!

Specifications:

Edge: Plain
Steel: 8Cr13MoV
Open Length: 2.48" (62.99 mm)
Weight: 0.8 oz (22.68g)
Handle: 8Cr13MoV
Style: Fixed Blade Knife with Sheath
Sheath Material: Vinyl
feature_bullets: Portable Utility: Take this keychain tool with you
Useful Utility: Seat belt strap cutter
Useful Utility: Bottle opener, flat screwdriver, wrenches
Designed by Ray Kirk in Tahlequah, Oklahoma
Limited Lifetime Warranty covers any defects in materials or workmanship, see company site for details
